data.title: There's only one true bar in downtown Bham
data.text: Thank goodness we found this place. Bham has a lot of vacant storefronts. But we found the rogue and it's a great place. Friendly people. Great service. Clean. Brunch menu looked great- plus they serve carafes of mimosas for $5. Wow. Lots of tv's and big screens. But if Alabama is on- you're watching Alabama - and don't ask for Ohio State! We might have to watch it in our hotel room later!!!

owner_response.author: , General Manager at Rogue Tavern, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hey there! We're so happy you found us! With our love for 'Bama, I do have to agree that we will be watching the game, but we're always happy to work with requests. It's our goal to make you feel as welcome as possible, and if we can ever go that extra step, we will. I do hope you'll be back in again soon, but until then, take care!

Sincerely, 
Hayden W., General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Rogue Art
data.text: Downtown in the Ham was great Saturday. Sunny, lots of art for the art walk, patrons jamming the bar and tables while cheering different teams for college football. Rogue was a little overwhelmed but bless the serving staff, they gave 100%. The pimento cheese sliders were tasty. Pitchers flowed. Hated we had to leave mid afternoon.  Would do it again.

owner_response.author: , General Manager at Rogue Tavern, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Sounds like you had a perfect afternoon in Birmingham, Ray! Knowing that we could add to that is pretty special, and I'm even happier that you could join us when we were full-energy and cheering on our favorite teams. I appreciate the recognition for our hard-working staff -- we want to keep the drinks full and the plates piping hot, and I love that we could do that for you. You sound like someone who really knows how to enjoy his days in any city, so I'm sending you all the best wishes on your next adventure!

Sincerely, 
Hayden W., General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Better than "Bar Food"
data.text: We were looking for a bite to eat after work on a Friday while waiting for the traffic home to die down and stumbled into Rogue Tavern.  We were greeted at the door by hostesses and seated immediately.  Our waiter Chis was friendly, talkative, attentive, and informative.  I ordered the Island Cobb salad and my date had the Rogue Burger with Fries.  Both very good.  Decent selection of beers on tap and in bottles.  Date tried a new IPA that we haven't seen around town.  Salad had plenty of chicken and was fresh.  Really good burger & fries.  Total bill about $30 for entree salad, burger and a couple of brews on a Friday night.  Couple of very large TVs and a couple of projectors with sports-bet its a great place to watch some football!

owner_response.author: , General Manager at Rogue Tavern, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
This sounds like such a great coincidence that we could welcome you in while traffic died down! It's always a good day when we can invite in some new faces, especially when our hostesses are on hand to ensure you immediately get the Rogue Tavern hello. Hopefully you'll be on this side of town during the next game -- we have quite the crowd for those game days, and we'd love for you to join in on the fun.

Until next time, 
Hayden W., General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place
data.text: I had thought this was just a local bar, but it is far from it.  The food is great! Don't miss the pot roast and mashed potatoes. I have not had better anywhere. They also have live music later in the evening. The service and atmosphere are also winners. We always enjoy this place.

owner_response.author: , General Manager at Rogue Tavern, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Pamela, we are a local bar, but we love that it feels like something bigger! I don't take it lightly that we're a winner in your book, and I'm overjoyed that you've joined us for our live music nights. I hope you've visited us again more recently, but in any case, I hope to see you again soon!

Sincerely, 
Hayden W., General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Rogue is Getting Better!
data.text: I'm writing a new review because while my previous trip to Rogue (and review) wasn't so good, I had a great experience last week. The service was very fast, and the food arrived so quickly, you'd have thought they saw us coming!  But it was fresh, hot and delicious.  The "Fresh Catch of the Day" sandwich has graduated from Tilapia to a choice of Salmon or MahiMahi.  I had the latter and it was perfectly done, not overcooked at all. The service was impeccble, the ambiance inviting as always. I'd have given it 5 but they put some sort of caramel sauce on perfectly good sweet potato fries.  Most people probably like them that way.  Rogue is a solidly good food joint with a great beer menu.

owner_response.author: , General Manager at Rogue Tavern, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I truly appreciate the updated review -- the fact that you took the time to rewrite this just completely brightens my day. I want to make sure that our tavern is always headed in the right direction, and this is made possible by keeping an eye on what people are saying about our restaurant. I can't wait to have the pleasure to welcome you back in again soon -- we've got many more specials that we'd love to share with you! 

Until next time, 
Hayden W., General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great lunch place!
data.text:
My sister and I were visiting Birmingham on a video shoot, and we needed a place to eat lunch with our crew.  One of them suggested the Rogue Tavern and it turned out to be the perfect place to go.  Two of us had salads (caesar and a goat cheese), and both were excellent.  The other two had sandwiches which were just what the doctor ordered!  The sweet tea was great, particularly for two Northerners who don't have access to that treat! 

One cool thing is that it is also a music venue, and that afternoon a local music camp was given the stage during the day to perform.  We only saw them setting up, but everyone commented what a cool thing it was for the Rogue Tavern to do!

data.title: Not as Expected
data.text: My husband and I went into the Rogue Tavern for a late lunch one afternoon. The place was dead, so of course we expected pretty fast service...Nope, service was slow and inattentive. We will probably not go back with all of the other, better options that are available.

data.title: Lunch with colleagues
data.text: Great service, changes in order were adapted to and food was excellent.  This place was packed when we arrived and still received great food and service.  Unique music interior where many come to play and listen.

data.title: Pretty good for a bar
data.text: We stopped in before an event downtown and quite quickly were seated. The food, while good, was not really anything special. The service was slow and we had to repeatedly ask for our ticket so we could get to the event on time. There are better options on 2nd Avenue!

data.title: Reliable Fare Day or Night
data.text: On another day, Rogue would have been a 4.  Today I was reminded how slapdash the service is.  Wait Staff chose to hand me a menu (no water) and clean a half a dozen tables before returning.  After that, the sandwich was good, and the draft beer options, as always, was was extensive.  Rogue hops at night, often with good local music, and during the day is a good place for a business meeting.

data.title: Quick bite
data.text:
Stopped in for a late lunch while in town for business. The place was pretty quiet due to the time (around 2) but it looks like it gets quite lively in the evenings. Service was fast and the staff were great. 
I tried the chicken tortilla soup and it was marvelous. The menu was pretty extensive and had I more time I would have loved to try the PO boys or brisket.

data.title: Great night out
data.text: This was our first visit to Rogue Tavern and it was a fun bar / restaurant. Food was pretty typical bar food and drinks were standard fare. It's bigger than it looks and has a great atmosphere.

data.title: Nice Bar
data.text: Nice cross between a sports bar and a college bar.  Plenty of room for large groups.  Typical bar food.  The best part is the outdoor seating area out back.  This is the kind of place you could hang out all night  and not feel rushed to leave.

data.title: Good every time
data.text: I have eaten at Rogue four times and have always been pleased with the food and service. On a recent visit there were eight of us at a table and everyone was pleased with their selection. Three of us asked for to-go boxes. I ordered the Spinach & Goat Cheese Salad for $9.50 - Fresh baby spinach topped with a fried feta ball, crumbled goat cheese, strawberries, & toasted almonds with a sherry vinaigrette. There were actually two of those delicious fried feta balls on the salad - yummy. Also enjoyed at the table was the lettuce wedge salad and black and blue sliders. Someone else passed around their sweet potato fries which were a bit like dessert.

owner_response.author: , General Manager at Rogue Tavern, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Jenny, I know it's been a little while since you wrote this, but I still can't hide how happy it makes me to read this. I love that our restaurant is a place you can depend on for such a large group -- with that many people, it's hard not to have a fantastic conversation. Hopefully you've visited us for a fifth and sixth time since writing this, but if not, we're looking forward to welcoming you back in again very soon. 

Sincerely, 
Hayden W., General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Back to this Downtown Birmingham Hotspot - Not disappointed
data.text: My wife and I went back to this bar/pub/restaurant for an early dinner on a Wednesday and were glad to see that the food remains excellent.  They have a great beer selection (on draft and bottled) and very nice staff.  This is not a "fancy" place, and was a bit crowded (a private party filled about 1/3 of the place).  I note that they now have seating at an outside patio (too hot now to sit there during the day however).  My wife had a chicken quesadilla which she adored, and I had the fried green tomato BLT sliders - which were GREAT.  We will certainly try to frequent this gem more often.

data.title: Girls night out
data.text: Are you ready for this? An eatery with your best bar combination of finger food. Then entrees that are as filling as Sunday Brunch. Wow. Loved it. It is guaranteed that you will see Somebody you know dining here. Best happy hour wings around. Get on in there, Chile!

data.title: Fun Atmosphere
data.text: This place eclectic food choices that were really good.  We ordered the Shrimp Po Boy, Cheeseburger Sliders and the Lettuce Wraps and nobody was disappointed.  The sweet potato fries with maple syrup drizzled over them were amazing.  Decent beer selection and a full bar (minus blended drinks) and homemade desserts topped off a fun evening here.  They also have live music and the solo musician the night we were there interacted with the crowd adding to the fun.

data.title: Great place for groups
data.text: Great food, entertainment and drinks. Prefect place for a group of friends. The food is nothing out of the ordinary but very good.

data.title: Passing through
data.text: Seemed to be a typical sports bar atmosphere. Perfect place to hop in to have a beer on a bar hopping extravaganza. Relaxing with live music. Only had one beer and no food. Good beer selection and waitress was able to make a great suggestion for our stop. (Salty Nut IPA) Had a chance to talk to Jazz, the GM, who was very nice and even helped us plan our next 10 stops for the night.

data.title: Friday Night
data.text: Really like this place! Great pub/bar food! If a mistake came up in order they were great about comping with a free beer to make it right! The band was fun! They played 80s style songs. Great atmosphere good location worth the visit :) jalapeño burger is a must try!
